intro: Hirschfeldia pseudosinapis, commonly known as the Chinese hirschfeldia, is a flowering plant native to central and southern China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the Brassicaceae family. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
